title: (Probably) easy serif face from the Breakfast at Tiffany's book
content:
Hi, can anyone ID this typeface for me? I’ve got to recreate this book jacket for an 8 foot high prop!

I’m sure I know what it is, but I just can’t find it.

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [capote breakfast 500.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015210012/http:/typophile.com/files/capote%20breakfast%20500.jpg) | 128.78 KB |

 [‹ Zany font to ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015210012/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47071 "Go to previous forum topic") [Any one know this script type font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015210012/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47066 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bluecube

comments.content: That’s what I thought, but the a and r are different I’m sure.

I think it seems pretty close to [Monotype Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015210012/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/mondosearchresults.htm?kid=Monotype+Bodoni&st=12), based on the k and the t, but if this is an original edition this was probably done with metal or film type.

- Mike Yanega
